segments.text: I notice the water is just pouring over the edge of the sink, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is on the floor now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are going to slip and hurt themselves if they’re not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like he’s a circus performer.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if he even realizes how dangerous that is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be in for a big surprise when she finally turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is just a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away, even though I know I should.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still running, and it’s just getting worse by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR
